item.title: 'I'm 52 and falling short of my £30k retirement plan - how can I hit my target?'
item.author: telegraph.co.uk
item.description:
Dear Kyle,
I'm 52 and mortgage-free. I work full time, have no dependents and would like to retire at 67 (assuming the state pension age doesn't increase).
A total of £1,750 a month goes into my pensions, including employer contributions and marginal tax relief. I hope to increase my contributions...

item.author: WELTplus
item.description: Das Jahr 2024, das steht jetzt schon fest, wird als Wendejahr in die Wirtschaftsgeschichte eingehen. Negativ ist die Entwicklung der deutschen Industrie.
